Item ID4695

Mist runes are combination runes. They count as two separate runes: one water rune and one air rune. Thus, any spell requiring one water rune, one air rune, or both will spend only one mist rune.

They can be created with the Runecraft skill or purchased with Pizazz points from the Mage Training Arena.

10 lava runes and 10 mist runes are required for the completion of Swan Song.

When equipped, the mist battlestaff and mystic mist staff provide an unlimited number of mist runes.

Contents

  • 1 Runecraft info
    • 1.1 Air Altar
    • 1.2 Water Altar
  • 2 Spells requiring both air and water runes
  • 3 Item sources
  • 4 Changes
    • 4.1 Gallery (historical)

Runecraft info[edit | edit source]

At 6 Runecraft or higher, they can be crafted in either of two ways:

  • Bringing pure essence, water runes, and a water talisman to the Air Altar (for 8.0 Runecraft xp per rune)
  • Bringing pure essence, air runes, and an air talisman to the Water Altar (for 8.5 Runecraft xp per rune)

You may wear a tiara to enter and use the altar, but the other element must be a talisman when crafting combination runes. Clicking on the altar or using a pure essence on it will produce normal runes. To prevent creating the wrong runes, make sure you are using the complementary rune on the altar. For example, at the Water Altar use the air runes on the altar.

Combinations have a 50% success rate (or 100%, if the player is wearing a binding necklace), and the talisman is consumed in the process (unless the player uses the Lunar spell Magic Imbue). The elemental talisman will also not work in place of talismans when crafting the runes.

They count as two separate runes: one [[water rune]] ''and'' one [[air rune]]. Thus, any spell requiring one water rune, one air rune, or both will spend only one mist rune. They can be created with the [[Runecraft]] skill or purchased with [[Pizazz points]] from the [[Mage Training Arena]]. 10 [[lava rune]]s and 10 mist runes are required for the completion of [[Swan Song]]. When equipped, the [[mist battlestaff]] and [[mystic mist staff]] provide an unlimited number of mist runes. ==Runecraft info== At {{SCP|Runecraft|6|link=yes}} or higher, they can be crafted in either of two ways: * Bringing [[pure essence]], [[water rune]]s, and a [[water talisman]] to the [[Air Altar]] (for 8.0 Runecraft xp per rune) * Bringing pure essence, [[air rune]]s, and an [[air talisman]] to the [[Water Altar]] (for 8.5 Runecraft xp per rune) You may wear a [[Tiara (disambiguation)|tiara]] to enter and use the altar, but the other element '''must''' be a [[talisman]] when crafting combination runes. Clicking on the altar or using a pure essence on it will produce normal runes. To prevent creating the wrong runes, make sure you are using the complementary rune on the altar. For example, at the Water Altar use the air runes on the altar. Combinations have a 50% success rate (or 100%, if the player is wearing a [[binding necklace]]), and the talisman is consumed in the process (unless the player uses the [[Lunar spellbook|Lunar spell]] [[Magic Imbue]]).
